text: <@U05743K5BHT> That's why you label it as v1.0 :rolling_on_the_floor_laughing:

elements.text: That's why you label it as v1.0

text:
<@U05743K5BHT>
For project proposals, we are mostly checking that what you list as features will both count and set you up well for project demos with employers. You are welcome to make changes as needed. Actually, we have a lecture planned to cover rescoping, to encourage making necessary changes where needed.

For resumes, because you are submitting links for Google docs, you and me (or any other reviewer) can make changes in real time without having to continue sending links back and forth. We will talk about this on Thursday, but I expect the project portion of your resumes to be very basic when you first submit. I'll detail this out a little better in lecture, but your first submission should be all you can do right now. It will go through at least 2 reviews, and you will get edits/suggestions/comments directly on your resume for you to address after each one.

text: <@U056Z2CTTGX> We will work with folks needing revisions as quickly as possible, and you'll be able to resubmit prior to the Project Checkpoint (class 8 )
